title: Linux Security
text: During my internship at Qualcomm, I worked on SyzKaller, an open source kernel fuzzer used to discover bugs and potential security exploits.

title: CCHacks
text: Organized coding&&community's first hackathon for high school students in Troy, New York. Over 20 students attended, working over the course of a day to build projects including websites, circuits with Arduinos and video games.

title: Rensselaer Union Voting System
text: The Rensselaer Union develops its own voting software for student government elections. I work on maintaining and improving security and integrity for the system.

title: Club Management System
text: The Rensselaer Union develops its own software for managing clubs, serving the entire RPI student body. The software allows for student government, club officers, and union administration to manage club membership, budgets and inventories.

title: New York State STEP
text: I participate in coding&&community, a club at RPI that works with New York State's Science and Technology Entry Program to provide free coding lessons to disadvantaged local students.

title: 18moons DevOps Internship
text: Migrated a large Content Management System from legacy servers, and deployed a new streamlined system on Amazon Web Services.

title: Scrapbook
text: I designed and built an experimental app that merged elements of social media and conventional messaging apps.
